name: Auto / Auto-Heavy
content:
Auto weapons have the capacity of firing several rounds with each attack. This is used with area effects and when increasing damage against specific targets. A weapon with an auto property need not employ that property, though some abilities require it. Auto weapons are broken up into two subcategories, @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.450g1kbvRQoe1x5P]{Auto and Auto-Heavy}.

Auto weapons can fire in single-shot mode or in 5- round bursts (called an @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.ost2kpgNPC5XqNdb]{Autofire} attack). Auto-Heavy can fire in single-shot mode or in aggressive 10-round bursts (also called an @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.ost2kpgNPC5XqNdb]{Autofire} attack). In single-shot mode, the weapon uses its normal damage die. In autofire mode, use the alternate damage value listed on the table.

All @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.450g1kbvRQoe1x5P]{Auto or Auto-Heavy} weapons also have the @Compendium[compendiums-mix-dnd5e.um5-weaponproperties.HE1gIc0o7bZeLjFT]{Burst Fire} property (thus it is not listed on the table). When making a burst fire attack with a weapon with the auto property, you use ten rounds of ammunition, but do not use the improved damage die. With the heavy-auto property, you use ten rounds of ammunition and the improved damage die.
